Reason: The configuration 'native_transport_max_concurrent_connections_per_ip' is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts system performance by controlling the number of concurrent client connections per source IP. The code snippet related to this configuration involves checking the number of connections per IP and closing the connection if it exceeds the configured limit. This operation is time-expensive and can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, especially in scenarios with a high frequency of incoming client connections. Setting a lower limit can help prevent resource exhaustion and potential denial of service attacks, while setting it to -1 (unlimited) can potentially lead to resource exhaustion due to too many concurrent connections.
